I watched my first convention in 1980
with my grandfather my grandfather was
born to a farming family in rural Cuba
childhood polio left him permanently
disabled because he couldn't work the

was the only one in his family that knew
how to read he was a huge influence on
me growing up as a boy I used to sit on

three daily Padron cigars now I don't
remember it's been three decades since
we last sat on that porch and I don't

the one thing he wanted me never to

there was no limit how far I could go
because I was an American
now for those of us here's why I say

your rights or whatever your rulers

and we're special we're special because

and that Almighty God is the source of

we're special we're special because

maybe after years of hard work this was

where anything is possible but you just

we live in a troubled time but the story

and Mitt Romney is running for president
because he knows that if we are willing

my mother was one of seven girls whose
parents often went to bed hungry so
their children wouldn't my father lost
his mother when he was nine he had to
leave school and go to work and he would

they immigrated to America with little

dad was a bartender my mom was a cashier
a hotel maid a stock clerk at Kmart they
never made it big they were never rich
and yet they were successful because
just a few decades removed from
hopelessness they made possible for us
all the things that had been impossible
for them many nights growing up I would

16-hour day many mornings I woke up just
as my mother got home from the overnight

you're in a hurry
the meaning of moments like this escape
you but now as my children get older I

in this country in this country you're

bartender he was grateful for the work
he had but that's not the life he wanted
for us you see he stood behind a bar and
in the back of the room all those years
so one day I could stand behind a podium

that journey that journey from behind

the essence of the American miracle that
we're exceptional not because we have

because dreams that are impossible
anywhere else they come true here but
but that's not just my story that's your

that the doors that have been closed for

they struggled through poverty and the

his son Mitt Romney will be elected

in America
in America we are all just a generation

America is the story of everyday people

famous
but in the lives they live you will find

to make sure that America is still a

we decide do we want our children to

because Mitt Romney believes that if we

ever and their achievements will

the story of our time will be written by

let us make sure they write that we did

we chose more government instead of more

we chose the principles of our founding

my fellow Republicans my fellow
